Description: Five beads in different shapes and materials. A: One roughly spherical bead made of carnelian, not fully polished yet, drilled from one side. B: One segmented cylindrical bead made of turquoise faience, both ends preserved. C: Three disc-shaped beads, one of them broken and slightly larger than the other two, two of them made of vivid turquoise faience, one made of white faience.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), North west corner just outside the temenos
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
